qas.question: What is asthma the result of?

answers.text: chronic inflammation of the conducting zone of the airways

qas.question: What two airways are most effected by asthma?
In what ways do airways change?

answers.text: an increase in eosinophils and thickening of the lamina reticularis

qas.question: What other cell types are involced with the changing of airways?
What other components of the immune systems are included?

answers.text: cytokines, chemokines, histamine, and leukotrienes among others

plausible_answers.text: chronic inflammation of the conducting zone of the airways

qas.question: What is neutrophils the result of?
What part of the airway is especially effected by neutrophils?

plausible_answers.text: an increase in eosinophils and thickening of the lamina reticularis
the airways' smooth muscle may increase in size along with an increase in the numbers of mucous glands

qas.question: What chronic changes happen to the macrophages?

plausible_answers.text: cytokines, chemokines, histamine, and leukotrienes among others

qas.question: What other parts of the immune system are changed due to thickening of the neutrophils?

context: Asthma is the result of <a0_0><b5_0>chronic inflammation of the conducting zone of the airways<b5_0/><a0_0/> (most especially <a1_0><b6_0>the bronchi and bronchioles<b6_0/><a1_0/>), which subsequently results in increased contractability of the surrounding smooth muscles. This among other factors leads to bouts of narrowing of the airway and the classic symptoms of wheezing. The narrowing is typically reversible with or without treatment. Occasionally the airways themselves change. Typical changes in the airways include <a2_0><b7_0>an increase in eosinophils and thickening of the lamina reticularis<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Chronically <b8_0>the airways' smooth muscle may increase in size along with an increase in the numbers of mucous glands<b8_0/>. Other cell types involved include: <a3_0>T lymphocytes, macrophages, and neutrophils<a3_0/>. There may also be involvement of other components of the immune system including: <a4_0><b9_0>cytokines, chemokines, histamine, and leukotrienes among others<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
